docs.lead_paragraph: One of the top stories in the news this week is the revelation that Arnold Schwarzenegger, a Hollywood actor who served two terms as governor of California, fathered a child with a member of his household’s staff approximately 13 years ago, and kept it a secret until now. What are your thoughts about this story, and about the controversy over the related privacy issues?

headline.main: What’s Your Reaction to the Schwarzenegger Scandal?

docs.abstract: Are there real issues at stake in the story about Arnold Schwarzenegger’s transgressions, or is it mere gossip?
docs.snippet: Are there real issues at stake in the story about Arnold Schwarzenegger’s transgressions, or is it mere gossip?

docs.lead_paragraph: Stories of an affair and a child were flying around eight years ago, when Arnold Schwarzenegger ran for office.

byline.contributor:
Adam Nagourney reported from
Los Angeles, and Jennifer Steinhauer
from Washington. Reporting
was contributed by Michael
Cieply, Jennifer Medina, Ian Lovett
and Ana Facio Contreras from
Los Angeles.
byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY and JENNIFER STEINHAUER

docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS -- France's first lady, Carla Bruni-Sarkozy, is expecting a child, according to her father-in-law, who spoke to a German tabloid on Tuesday. French tabloids have been speculating about a possible presidential pregnancy for weeks. ''I'm looking forward to having a grandchild,'' said Pal Sarkozy, 83, a former publicist-turned-painter and the father of President Nicolas Sarkozy, in an interview with the tabloid Bild.
docs.abstract: Pal Sarkozy, father of French Pres Nicolas Sarkozy, announces to German newspaper that first lady Carla Bruni-Sarkozy is expecting a child; analysts speculate that pregnancy could improve image of Sarkozy, who is the most unpopular French leader in decades; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: 2:52 p.m. | Updated NBC, hoping to rebound from almost a decade of conspicuous failure, will count heavily on its lineup of talent competitions to set up a new season packed with 12 new scripted series.

headline.main: Upfronts: NBC Bets on Talent Shows and Scripted Series

docs.abstract: NBC will count heavily on its lineup of talent competitions to set up a new fall season packed with 12 new scripted series.
